intro: Decaloba piligera, commonly known as the red-flowered rock heath, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, commonly known as the heath family, and is characterized by its compact growth habit and evergreen foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to deep red, typically blooming in the spring. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
